greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: An analog of A000005 for nonstandard factorization based on the sieve of Eratosthenes (A083221).
comment: See A302042, A302044 and A302045 for a description of the factorization process.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
program: ordinal_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), pt); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), pt = mapget(om, invec[i]), pt = 0); outvec[i] = (1+pt); mapput(om,invec[i],(1+pt))); outvec; };
\\ Or, using also some of the code from above:
A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ From A003961
xref: Cf. A000005, A083221, A302042, A302044, A302045, A302052 (reduced modulo 2), A302053 (gives the positions of odd numbers).
Cf. also A253557, A302041, A302050, A302052, A302039, A302055 for other similar analogs.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 01 2018
